intro: Veronica sintenisiana, commonly known as the Sintenis's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains in South America. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and hairy, basal leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
